commit_message:
Ensure SELinux file context is applied on data directories

When SELinux is in 'enforcing' mode, we need to label the data
directories.

Change-Id: Ic2c376999315c89ae05e45a2aab31cacf3369b6a
Closes-Bug: 1611893
(cherry picked from commit f13493abc38cb13eec94bf203f15ec1d26d7ad28)

commit_message:
Update Craton's job layout

We would like to start making sure our docs build as well as making our
experimental job voting. We have had several reviews that successfully
used the experimental job and we'd like it to be voting at this point.

Successful uses of the experimental job:
- https://review.openstack.org/432283
- https://review.openstack.org/434506
- https://review.openstack.org/435038

Change-Id: I01eff9b333d12ea40f6ffc0500f18c368403dc51

service_name & auth_name need to be used properly

In puppet-ceilometer module, auth_name is used as service title instead of
service name and auth_name overriding code is missing.

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-09-30 18:54:03.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/wsgi/apache.pp', 'spec/classes/keystone_wsgi_apache_spec.rb'], 'message': "Tune number of apache processes/threads for Keystone in apache.

1) Change the default value for threads to be '1'.
2) Change the default value for workers to be $:os_workers:
3) If workers > 32, send a Puppet warning because this scenario is
   usually not helpful.

Using Rally to benchmark Keystone in apache, large gains are made by
using multiple processes to host Keystone rather than multiple threads.

Results posted here: http://paste.openstack.org/show/492167/

The above was tested on a 32 logical core machine at 256 constant
concurrency.

Co-Authorized-By: Alex Krzos <akrzos@redhat.com>
Co-Authorized-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authorized-By: Adam Young <ayoung@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id133ba5ed83fca7c75510f31eada313542031672
"}]
commit_message:
Tune number of apache processes/threads for Keystone in apache.

1) Change the default value for threads to be '1'.
2) Change the default value for workers to be $:os_workers:
3) If workers > 32, send a Puppet warning because this scenario is
   usually not helpful.

Using Rally to benchmark Keystone in apache, large gains are made by
using multiple processes to host Keystone rather than multiple threads.

Results posted here: http://paste.openstack.org/show/492167/

The above was tested on a 32 logical core machine at 256 constant
concurrency.

Co-Authorized-By: Alex Krzos <akrzos@redhat.com>
Co-Authorized-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authorized-By: Adam Young <ayoung@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id133ba5ed83fca7c75510f31eada313542031672

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-04-21 02:05:07.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/resource/authtoken.pp', 'spec/defines/keystone_resource_authtoken_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Refactor keystone::resource::authtoken

This patch aims to make keystone::resource::authtoken work

B/C the define has not been maintained for a long time,
almost all of parameters have been removed or deprecated in

commit_message:
Refactor keystone::resource::authtoken

This patch aims to make keystone::resource::authtoken work
with current keystonemiddleware, and will use this to replace
duplicated keystone_authtoken parameters in other modules.

B/C the define has not been maintained for a long time,
almost all of parameters have been removed or deprecated in
master branch of keystonemiddleware.

To keep compatbility, this patch reserves all parameters, and
add warning info to notify which parameters have been removed
and which have been deprecated.

Closes-Bug: #1533476
Change-Id: I14415c56891183eead4880ea52cc12fc5bf516ee

subject: Add actions for renaming volume host attr
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-22 09:54:55.000000000', 'files': ['actions/actions.py', 'actions/volume-host-add-driver', 'unit_tests/test_actions_cinder_manage.py', 'actions/cinder_manage.py', 'unit_tests/__init__.py', 'actions/remove-services', 'actions/rename-volume-host', 'actions.yaml'], 'message': 'Add actions for renaming volume host attr

Add two new actions which are essentially wrappers around

cinder-manage volume update_host \
    --currenthost CURRENTHOST \
    --newhost NEWHOST

In previous versions of the charm if block-device is set or the
legacy ceph relation is used (as opposed to storage-backend relation)
then the configuration of those backends is done in the [DEFAULT]
section of the cinder.conf. As of Ocata that is no longer supported
and backends need to be listed in their own sections and referenced
via enable_backends parameter. This change in config results in a
change of host name and existing volumes need to have their metadata
updated to point at the new hostname.

Old Hostname: <unit-name>
New Hostname: <unit-name>@<backend section name>#<volume-backend-name>

New Action: volume-backend-name
Used for updating the host attribute of volumes to add the driver
name. This is needed after an upgrade to Ocata if there are existing
volumes which have been configured prior to multi-backends
being enabled.

New Action: rename-volume-host
Used for updating the host attribute of volumes. This action is
a lower level action then volume-host-add-driver and simply passes
the old and new hosts verbatim to cinder-manage.

Change-Id: I989074a3f41126aa57c514f7e18b887733bc18fe
Partial-Bug: #1665272
'}]
commit_message:
Add actions for renaming volume host attr

Add two new actions which are essentially wrappers around

cinder-manage volume update_host \
    --currenthost CURRENTHOST \
    --newhost NEWHOST

In previous versions of the charm if block-device is set or the
legacy ceph relation is used (as opposed to storage-backend relation)
then the configuration of those backends is done in the [DEFAULT]
section of the cinder.conf. As of Ocata that is no longer supported
and backends need to be listed in their own sections and referenced
via enable_backends parameter. This change in config results in a
change of host name and existing volumes need to have their metadata
updated to point at the new hostname.

Old Hostname: <unit-name>
New Hostname: <unit-name>@<backend section name>#<volume-backend-name>

New Action: volume-backend-name
Used for updating the host attribute of volumes to add the driver
name. This is needed after an upgrade to Ocata if there are existing
volumes which have been configured prior to multi-backends
being enabled.

New Action: rename-volume-host
Used for updating the host attribute of volumes. This action is
a lower level action then volume-host-add-driver and simply passes
the old and new hosts verbatim to cinder-manage.

Change-Id: I989074a3f41126aa57c514f7e18b887733bc18fe
Partial-Bug: #1665272

commit_message:
Rely on docker being available in the undercloud

Starting from Ocata, the undercloud already has docker installed and
enabled. There is not much value in deploying a containerized overcloud
prior to Ocata as it was experimental and the TripleO container
architecture is being completely revamped anyway.

Change-Id: I71c35fc416d7b91a4ebf7c103e04163d7ea560a5

commit_message:
Cap the number of worker threads

Users can configure the number of worker threads however when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

commit_message:
Compress murano-dashboard JS scripts within a common context

This patch moves all murano-dashboard JS scripts to ADD_JS_FILES
setting and gets rid of murano_base.html template which sole purpose
is including these scripts.
This can fix the render issue in Components tab.

Change-Id: If14e3bd4ea9764857deb7a2997d3d2d0f4daba7c
Closes-Bug: #1654809
Co-Authored-By: Timur Sufiev <tsufiev@mirantis.com>

subject: Hacky workaround for openssh rpm regression
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-21 08:25:07.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp'], 'message': "Hacky workaround for openssh rpm regression

So this is a rather unsavoury workaround for an openssh
bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1415218
Until we get a fixed package in centos it is best we work
around it as it fails 10% of our CI jobs.

Only setting partial bug below for two reasons:
A) I believe we can hit this in the overcloud as well (although it
   won't hurt us as badly in CI terms)
B) I think we're more likely to remember to remove this code
   when we get a fixed openssh package if there is a bug open

Partial-Bug: #1657173

Change-Id: I93043c3c79f64ddf1a63cbe6a3dc03138296bc89
"}]
commit_message:
Hacky workaround for openssh rpm regression

So this is a rather unsavoury workaround for an openssh
bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1415218
Until we get a fixed package in centos it is best we work
around it as it fails 10% of our CI jobs.

Only setting partial bug below for two reasons:
A) I believe we can hit this in the overcloud as well (although it
   won't hurt us as badly in CI terms)
B) I think we're more likely to remember to remove this code
   when we get a fixed openssh package if there is a bug open

Partial-Bug: #1657173

Change-Id: I93043c3c79f64ddf1a63cbe6a3dc03138296bc89

commit_message:
magnum domain register error at setting domain id

Setting up Magnum fails at creating and setting magnum's trustee
domain.
The changes this patch introduces follow.
  - add registering trustee_domain
  - remove unnecessary set_fact as this variable is used only once

Change-Id: I1c1ed8a20871fb4e9f153c6dd1431d9b6fd286a5
Closes-Bug: #1667209

subject: Add functional test for "nova boot --image-with"
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-02-22 12:19:49.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/functional/v2/test_servers.py', 'novaclient/tests/functional/base.py', 'novaclient/tests/functional/v2/legacy/test_servers.py'], 'message': 'Add functional test for "nova boot --image-with"

We have no functional testing for creating a server
using the --image-with option, which is going to be
impacted when we remove our deprecated code for the
image proxy API in Nova.

This adds a functional test for that flow which
creates a server, snapshots the server with a meta
key/value, then creates a second server using
--image-with and specifying the same meta key/value
set on the snapshot image.

Change-Id: I30017380d3e8dba6f1a50dfdda5eb4802b498bb4
'}]
commit_message:
Add functional test for "nova boot --image-with"

We have no functional testing for creating a server
using the --image-with option, which is going to be
impacted when we remove our deprecated code for the
image proxy API in Nova.

This adds a functional test for that flow which
creates a server, snapshots the server with a meta
key/value, then creates a second server using
--image-with and specifying the same meta key/value
set on the snapshot image.

Change-Id: I30017380d3e8dba6f1a50dfdda5eb4802b498bb4

commit_message:
Cap the number of worker threads

Users can configure the number of worker threads however when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: I10a653dda7444b756fede74ce434b9038415c74c

commit_message:
Add an experimental job to Tempest to run Cinder v1 tests.

With I0edf1d88c136c3b910a5773690a603eeacb50266 we want to disable running
Cinder V1 Tempest tests. So let's add a job in the experimental queue
to still run these tests, on demand.

Change-Id: I29db63b96327c2e00ea07dd28730739f2e437448

commit_message:
Parallelize docker-puppet.py

Use a pool of worker processes to run the puppet modules so they
can all be done in parallel.  Defaults to cpu count processes.

Change-Id: I083d302b8cf6538569e4d165221c21df152266bc

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-12 02:08:21.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'message': 'Configure nova to use cinder v2

Nova is going to use cinder v3 by default in Pike
via change 8c7ce35a5665af3957e49c376f104c3c1e15f91d.

In order to test nova with cinder v2 in Pike, we need
to configure nova in stable/ocata to use cinder v2
so that grenade runs in Pike will use cinder v2 across
both Ocata and Pike.

Change-Id: I1f49d9b71c0b787641862a8374131b3f3808b236
'}]
commit_message:
Configure nova to use cinder v2

Nova is going to use cinder v3 by default in Pike
via change 8c7ce35a5665af3957e49c376f104c3c1e15f91d.

In order to test nova with cinder v2 in Pike, we need
to configure nova in stable/ocata to use cinder v2
so that grenade runs in Pike will use cinder v2 across
both Ocata and Pike.

Change-Id: I1f49d9b71c0b787641862a8374131b3f3808b236

commit_message:
publish: don't fail in case the logs dir is a link to a directory

currently the first task in publish checks if the logs dir is a
directory, and fails if it's a link to a directory.
Adding follow: yes so the location can be a directory pointed from a
link

Change-Id: I992a9c89d7b04fd2a890b8d85f86cc34e8767740

subject: neutron: don't set external_network_bridge option by default
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8788, 'name': 'Miguel Angel Ajo', 'email': 'mangelajo@redhat.com', 'username': 'mangelajo'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 23310, 'name': 'wanghongtaozz', 'email': 'wanghongtaozz@inspur.com', 'username': 'wanghongtaozz'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-12 11:26:16.000000000', 'files': ['environments/net-single-nic-linux-bridge-with-vlans.yaml', 'puppet/services/neutron-l3.yaml', 'environments/net-single-nic-with-vlans-no-external.yaml', 'environments/network-environment.yaml', 'environments/net-single-nic-with-vlans.yaml', 'environments/net-bond-with-vlans-v6.yaml', 'environments/net-bond-with-vlans-no-external.yaml', 'environments/net-single-nic-with-vlans-v6.yaml', 'environments/net-bond-with-vlans.yaml', 'puppet/services/neutron-l3-compute-dvr.yaml'], 'message': "neutron: don't set external_network_bridge option by default

It's deprecated, to be removed in Ocata, and it's discouraged to set it
to anything but the default value ('') that means that routers are not
plugged directly into br-ex, but allows l2 agent to do the wiring.

There are known issues with setting it to br-ex (like wrong port
statuses): If533cf7c4c379be78f5a15073accaff7f65973ab

The only caveat to setting it to the default ('') value is that in that
case l2 agent should be configured with bridge mapping for physical
networks. Since we already configure bridge_mappings for the agent, we
should be safe to unset the option.

Now that it's the default, there is no reason to override it in example
environments.

This patch also changes the description for the parameter to make it
more clear that users are not expected to set it unless they know what
they are doing. Also, moved the parameter into deprecated section to
make it even more clear it's not something to touch in new deployments.

Change-Id: Iade7fbaf92c8c601227f4456a15ea3f13a907ee2
Related-Bug: #1563070
"}]
commit_message:
neutron: don't set external_network_bridge option by default

It's deprecated, to be removed in Ocata, and it's discouraged to set it
to anything but the default value ('') that means that routers are not
plugged directly into br-ex, but allows l2 agent to do the wiring.

There are known issues with setting it to br-ex (like wrong port
statuses): If533cf7c4c379be78f5a15073accaff7f65973ab

The only caveat to setting it to the default ('') value is that in that
case l2 agent should be configured with bridge mapping for physical
networks. Since we already configure bridge_mappings for the agent, we
should be safe to unset the option.

Now that it's the default, there is no reason to override it in example
environments.

This patch also changes the description for the parameter to make it
more clear that users are not expected to set it unless they know what
they are doing. Also, moved the parameter into deprecated section to
make it even more clear it's not something to touch in new deployments.

Change-Id: Iade7fbaf92c8c601227f4456a15ea3f13a907ee2
Related-Bug: #1563070

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-04 11:05:44.000000000', 'files': ['tools/releasenotes_tox.sh', 'tools/flake8wrap.sh', 'tools/pretty_tox.sh', 'tools/pretty_tox3.sh'], 'message': "tools: Remove +x flag from scripts

All modified scripts are executed in tox like so:

    bash SCRIPT_NAME

We don't need these to be executable so simply remove the flags.

Change-Id: I56fa0c4401c1aa01e4f7efe2214421fd7d229c2b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
tools: Remove +x flag from scripts

All modified scripts are executed in tox like so:

    bash SCRIPT_NAME

We don't need these to be executable so simply remove the flags.

Change-Id: I56fa0c4401c1aa01e4f7efe2214421fd7d229c2b

commit_message:
Collect only cib* files from pacemaker

In patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/427074/ we collect the
whole directory which can contain file puppet-cib* which are
not needed and take a lot of space (about 3MB compressed), so
let's collect only cib* files from there.

Change-Id: I24ba89b8b8535d19fcd9fce4d846a263f541ae27

commit_message:
This feature is supporting for workers config in swift servers.

Currently it doesn't work in swift servers such as proxy-server,
object-server, account-server and container-server, in spite of
setting openstack_service_workers config in globals.yml.

Because it's not implement about workers in swift.

Closes-Bug: #1662751

Change-Id: Iae9a12952cd3fe285eed3d8fca2e667a68de15c7
Signed-off-by: jangseon ryu <jangseon.ryu@navercorp.com>
(cherry picked from commit 67aee9f8a22c7d9e319248e877e5131170be0f07)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8652, 'name': 'Attila Darazs', 'email': 'adarazs@redhat.com', 'username': 'adarazs'}, {'_account_id': 10022, 'name': 'Gabriele Cerami', 'email': 'gcerami@redhat.com', 'username': 'panda'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 11589, 'name': 'Harry Rybacki', 'email': 'hrybacki@redhat.com', 'username': 'hrybacki'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24752, 'name': 'RedHat RDO Downstream CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins+downstream@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci-downstream', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-22 14:07:32.000000000', 'files': ['roles/overcloud-prep-network/templates/overcloud-prep-network.sh.j2'], 'message': 'TLS-everywhere: Add nameserver to ctlplane subnet

currently, the overcloud_dns_servers variable is added to the DnsServers
parameter in heat, this parameter adds the nameserver for the overcloud
nodes once os-net-config runs. However, if we need these nameservers to
be set before this (for instance, when a cloud-init script runs), we
need something that runs before this.

So, adding the nameservers defined by this variable to the subnet works
for us in this case.

Change-Id: I8edb1e8fb700082ac6fac8995ebbb7bf27211f37
'}]
commit_message:
TLS-everywhere: Add nameserver to ctlplane subnet

currently, the overcloud_dns_servers variable is added to the DnsServers
parameter in heat, this parameter adds the nameserver for the overcloud
nodes once os-net-config runs. However, if we need these nameservers to
be set before this (for instance, when a cloud-init script runs), we
need something that runs before this.

So, adding the nameservers defined by this variable to the subnet works
for us in this case.

Change-Id: I8edb1e8fb700082ac6fac8995ebbb7bf27211f37

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-02-16 17:04:22.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml', 'tests/test-swift-upgrades.sh', 'tests/test-upgrade.yml', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Move swift upgrades into its own shell script

The upgrade path becomes complicated as previous variables are stored
and we have to start a clean run.

Change-Id: Ib2d2c8bad5241779d52cdc9428d7057c770d2d7c
'}]
commit_message:
Move swift upgrades into its own shell script

The upgrade path becomes complicated as previous variables are stored
and we have to start a clean run.

The best way to achieve this is to separate the run steps out in a shell
script for upgrades only.

Change-Id: Ib2d2c8bad5241779d52cdc9428d7057c770d2d7c

commit_message:
tests: Combine multiple NUMA-generation functions

There are a handful of ways to generate a LibvirtConfigCapsNUMATopology
for use in testing. Standardize them and kill the duplication. This
requires explicitly configuring mempages for the NUMA topology in some
places, but that seems like "A Good Thing" (TM).

Change-Id: I1efd99afbed23f64b7ba61d2cf449b2a48689baa

An upper-constraints update to psutil caused IPA to start using psutil
5.0.1. We had a hard-coded assumption that psutil would be major version

commit_message:
Support psutil 5.0.1

An upper-constraints update to psutil caused IPA to start using psutil
5.0.1. We had a hard-coded assumption that psutil would be major version
1 or 2. This allows us to use the updated psutil and attempts to simply
fail gracefully if an unrecognized psutil version is used.

Change-Id: Ibe072440159561b34a29b478d955876e5fb7f103
Closes-Bug: 1659137

subject: ironic-dnsmasq should use ironic-inspector group
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-22 23:06:02.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/ironic/tasks/pull.yml', 'ansible/roles/ironic/tasks/start.yml', 'ansible/roles/ironic/tasks/config.yml'], 'message': 'ironic-dnsmasq should use ironic-inspector group

The ironic_dnsmasq container is currently tied to the ironic-conductor
Ansible group. It is required only for Ironic inspector and should
really either be tied to the ironic-inspector group or have a new
ironic-dnsmasq group defined for it. This problem means that if all
hosts are removed from the ironic-inspector group I will still have an
ironic_dnsmasq container deployed.

This change uses the ironic-inspector group to determine where to place
the ironic_dnsmasq container.

Change-Id: I6af3f402795107b8b9d7a1619722f12cbf496257
Closes-Bug: #1666982
'}]
commit_message:
ironic-dnsmasq should use ironic-inspector group

The ironic_dnsmasq container is currently tied to the ironic-conductor
Ansible group. It is required only for Ironic inspector and should
really either be tied to the ironic-inspector group or have a new
ironic-dnsmasq group defined for it. This problem means that if all
hosts are removed from the ironic-inspector group I will still have an
ironic_dnsmasq container deployed.

This change uses the ironic-inspector group to determine where to place
the ironic_dnsmasq container.

Change-Id: I6af3f402795107b8b9d7a1619722f12cbf496257
Closes-Bug: #1666982

commit_message:
Remove skip of test_stamp_pattern

test_stamp_pattern is skipped of bug 1205344 which is reported at 2013,
though there is no exact hint on whether the bug is fixed or not, but
since 2013 is too long ago, we guess the bug should have been fixed.

This is to remove the skip, and to fix several obvious errors in the
code.

ironic_dnsmasq doesn't support reconfiguration

Currently the ironic_dnsmasq container does not support
reconfiguration. This change adds support for reconfiguration of
ironic_dnsmasq.

(cherry picked from commit 156b317c5ffb98bd24fbb5ae6a03a635eb317dc2)

commit_message:
Add support for the OneView audit logging

This allows Ironic support work with python-oneviewclient audition,
that is responsable for logging time, parameters values and return
values for each API request to OneView. This patch is about adding
three new options that allows OneView drivers users to enable or
disable OneView audit, set the path for auditing configuration file
and set auditing log file path as well.

Change-Id: Idc3fa2107676eaee9d9c7e8a8688a309ba4b14b0
Depends-On: Iae7fe8ec559ccb2cbf8f93486eb4a1a674d7053a

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2017-02-03 14:17:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py', 'nova/scheduler/client/report.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1661258-ee202843157f6a27.yaml'], 'message': 'Delete a compute node's resource provider when node is deleted

Currently when a compute node is deleted, its record in the cell DB is
deleted, but its representation as a resource provider in the placement
service remains, along with any inventory and allocations. This could
cause the placement engine to return that provider record, even though
the compute node no longer exists. And since the periodic "healing" by
the resource tracker only updates compute node resources for records in
the compute_nodes table, these old records are never removed.

This patch adds a call to delete the resource provider when the compute
node is deleted. It also adds a method to the scheduler report client
to make these calls to the placement API.

Partial-Bug: #1661258
Closes-Bug: #1661014

Change-Id: I6098d186d05ff8b9a568e23f860295a7bc2e6447
'}]
commit_message:
Delete a compute node's resource provider when node is deleted

Currently when a compute node is deleted, its record in the cell DB is
deleted, but its representation as a resource provider in the placement
service remains, along with any inventory and allocations. This could
cause the placement engine to return that provider record, even though
the compute node no longer exists. And since the periodic "healing" by
the resource tracker only updates compute node resources for records in
the compute_nodes table, these old records are never removed.

This patch adds a call to delete the resource provider when the compute
node is deleted. It also adds a method to the scheduler report client
to make these calls to the placement API.

Partial-Bug: #1661258
Closes-Bug: #1661014

Change-Id: I6098d186d05ff8b9a568e23f860295a7bc2e6447

commit_message:
api-ref: fix instance action 'message' description

There was a typo in the description of this parameter
and it also didn't read very clearly, so I've just
re-written the description of this.

On a side note, it's a bit odd that this is a required
parameter in the response (Tempest requires it in the
response schema) even though it's only set if the
action failed.

Change-Id: Ic84031119e2ffb6b1fb0b0a193967b2823464651

The negative tests of revert resized server API are not covered enough
in functional tests. We want to add the conflict tests
of when this API runs in the unexpected state of server.
* Case of revert resized server API, the server status must be VERIFY_RESIZE.

Change-Id: I67d7173156fb8cc93b209d6563b7d31c400cc2b3
'}]
commit_message:
Add revert resized server functional negative tests

The negative tests of revert resized server API are not covered enough
in functional tests. We want to add the conflict tests
of when this API runs in the unexpected state of server.
* Case of revert resized server API, the server status must be VERIFY_RESIZE.

Change-Id: I67d7173156fb8cc93b209d6563b7d31c400cc2b3

subject: Change service candidates list for MariaDB
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-02 16:18:31.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/strategies/backup/experimental/mariadb_impl.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/mysql_common/service.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/mariadb/service.py', 'trove/common/cfg.py', 'trove/guestagent/strategies/replication/experimental/mariadb_gtid.py', 'trove/guestagent/strategies/restore/experimental/mariadb_impl.py', 'trove/guestagent/strategies/replication/base.py', 'trove/guestagent/strategies/restore/mysql_impl.py', 'trove/guestagent/strategies/replication/mysql_base.py'], 'message': 'Change service candidates list for MariaDB

For MariaDB 10.1 on CentOS/RHEL, it is using mariadb.service
for systemd now instead of mysql.service. This change takes
this into account in how the service candidates list is managed.

Due to the change to service candidates, the restore and
replication strategies needed to change. Basically, now that
MariaDB is a full manager, it needs to have its "App" class
set properly (this is the restore strategy fix). Replication
broke because the replication strategy was using the Mysql
manager backup/restore strategy. This was fixed by doing a small
re-factor to add properties to the strategy base class to allow
for manager specific overrides.

Change-Id: I6aed32ebc704174aefe7543699169097532a1b55
Closes-bug: 1579110
'}]
commit_message:
Change service candidates list for MariaDB

For MariaDB 10.1 on CentOS/RHEL, it is using mariadb.service
for systemd now instead of mysql.service. This change takes
this into account in how the service candidates list is managed.

Due to the change to service candidates, the restore and
replication strategies needed to change. Basically, now that
MariaDB is a full manager, it needs to have its "App" class
set properly (this is the restore strategy fix). Replication
broke because the replication strategy was using the Mysql
manager backup/restore strategy. This was fixed by doing a small
re-factor to add properties to the strategy base class to allow
for manager specific overrides.

Change-Id: I6aed32ebc704174aefe7543699169097532a1b55
Closes-bug: 1579110

commit_message:
Enable automatic host cell discovery

Configure the scheduler to automatically discover and
map hosts into cell1 every 30 seconds ensuring that
hosts are discovered automatically.

This will be completed by future work to orchestrate
the enablement and mapping of compute hosts into cells
using relations and actions at a later date.

Change-Id: I5ed10e67936388bb074739b63e3a5ecf9036035f
Partial-Bug: 1667124

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-01 19:25:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/wsgi/test_servers.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/fixtures.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Remove pre-cellsv2 short circuit in instance get

This removes a couple short circuits around instance cell mapping,
which were in place for pre-cellsv2 code. Now, they defeat some of
our atomic logic around what should be done in and around deletes.
These were TODOs to remove once people had to be on cellsv2, which
is now the case.

Note that the api samples tests were depending on these in order to
work at all (which is a good demonstration of why they need to
be removed). This patch also extends the SingleCellSimple fixture
with a couple more mocks to make them happily take the same path
as the rest of the code. Since the default in that fixture is
now to make instances look mapped all the time, we also need a flag
so the tests that check for yet-to-be-mapped instances can still
function.

Related-Bug: #1660878
Change-Id: I7eb4b41fd2f33e8a63e329adbafc47d149e31552
'}]
commit_message:
Remove pre-cellsv2 short circuit in instance get

This removes a couple short circuits around instance cell mapping,
which were in place for pre-cellsv2 code. Now, they defeat some of
our atomic logic around what should be done in and around deletes.
These were TODOs to remove once people had to be on cellsv2, which
is now the case.

Note that the api samples tests were depending on these in order to
work at all (which is a good demonstration of why they need to
be removed). This patch also extends the SingleCellSimple fixture
with a couple more mocks to make them happily take the same path
as the rest of the code. Since the default in that fixture is
now to make instances look mapped all the time, we also need a flag
so the tests that check for yet-to-be-mapped instances can still
function.

Related-Bug: #1660878
Change-Id: I7eb4b41fd2f33e8a63e329adbafc47d149e31552

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-22 14:47:39.000000000', 'files': ['oslosphinx/theme/openstack/layout.html'], 'message': "Amended dev documentation side navigation

Amended developer documentation side navigation to add an option for
clearly returning to the project developer documentation home page.
Previously it was possible to return to the home page by clicking
'table of contents' however this is not obvious and makes it hard
to get around the complete project documentation once you have left
the homepage.

This patch removes the link from 'table of contents' which is
misleading, and a link is added beneath this header to say 'Return
to project home page'.

Change-Id: I7cf96acead62f00224ca9217a80760b4a65d42d6
Closes-bug: #1666323
"}]
commit_message:
Amended dev documentation side navigation

Amended developer documentation side navigation to add an option for
clearly returning to the project developer documentation home page.
Previously it was possible to return to the home page by clicking
'table of contents' however this is not obvious and makes it hard
to get around the complete project documentation once you have left
the homepage.

This patch removes the link from 'table of contents' which is
misleading, and a link is added beneath this header to say 'Return
to project home page'.

Change-Id: I7cf96acead62f00224ca9217a80760b4a65d42d6
Closes-bug: #1666323

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-14 14:49:37.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/compute/nova.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/compute/test_nova.py'], 'message': 'Change nova_catalog_admin_info to default to publicURL

The only services in OpenStack that have dedicated admin REST APIs
that actually enforce different permissions at the API level are
keystone and swift. Assuming there is a dedicated admin endpoint is an
artifical construct.

Change the default for the admin_info to be the normal public url. For
sites that really want 2 different values here, they can have it, but
default to the simpler thing.

Change-Id: I92efc4639d37cb2736bae7e40707a853f1e72be6
'}]
commit_message:
Change nova_catalog_admin_info to default to publicURL

The only services in OpenStack that have dedicated admin REST APIs
that actually enforce different permissions at the API level are
keystone and swift. Assuming there is a dedicated admin endpoint is an
artifical construct.

Change the default for the admin_info to be the normal public url. For
sites that really want 2 different values here, they can have it, but
default to the simpler thing.

Change-Id: I92efc4639d37cb2736bae7e40707a853f1e72be6

commit_message:
Allow update_cell param to be optional

currently the param for nova-manage cell_v2 update_cell
[--name <name>]
[--transport-url <transport>]
[--database_connection <database>
should be optional , but we didn't give default value.

Change-Id: I7c17d320fc33196f5570e258758204453153a037
Closes-Bug: 1664913

subject: ansible: swift: Fix swift-object-expirer restart loop
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-23 02:34:11.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/swift/defaults/main.yml', 'docker/swift/swift-object-expirer/Dockerfile.j2', 'ansible/roles/swift/tasks/start.yml'], 'message': "ansible: swift: Fix swift-object-expirer restart loop

The swift-object-expirer is provided by the 'openstack-swift-proxy'
package and thus it is unavailable on swift-object image. This change
adds a new Docker image to fulfill this requirement and stop using
swift-object image in this case.

This image is needed while RDO does not fix the packaging. The issue
is being tracked in:

  https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1382921

Co-Authored-By: Duong Ha-Quang <duonghq@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: Idc7ee92d756d8923da2198ede33abf5ed1142041
Closes-Bug: 1630425
(cherry picked from commit 9eb38405b7bf5575957860ae1da91c31279bf06d)
"}]
commit_message:
ansible: swift: Fix swift-object-expirer restart loop

The swift-object-expirer is provided by the 'openstack-swift-proxy'
package and thus it is unavailable on swift-object image. This change
adds a new Docker image to fulfill this requirement and stop using
swift-object image in this case.

This image is needed while RDO does not fix the packaging. The issue
is being tracked in:

  https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1382921

Co-Authored-By: Duong Ha-Quang <duonghq@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: Idc7ee92d756d8923da2198ede33abf5ed1142041
Closes-Bug: 1630425
(cherry picked from commit 9eb38405b7bf5575957860ae1da91c31279bf06d)

ironic_dnsmasq doesn't support reconfiguration

Currently the ironic_dnsmasq container does not support
reconfiguration. This change adds support for reconfiguration of
ironic_dnsmasq.

subject: Compare test coverage with the master branch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-17 09:01:22.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'cover.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Compare test coverage with the master branch

* checkout one commit before the latest and check coverage
* check coverage with the latest commit
* all new lines must be tested

This functionallity essentially compares the current change
with the master branch, since the coverage job runs always
for only one change.

Change-Id: I59b03d5c5e69a36b5fac9fef0576a29a885a5bba
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnumclient-ut-coverage
'}]
commit_message:
Compare test coverage with the master branch

* checkout one commit before the latest and check coverage
* check coverage with the latest commit
* all new lines must be tested

This functionallity essentially compares the current change
with the master branch, since the coverage job runs always
for only one change.

Change-Id: I59b03d5c5e69a36b5fac9fef0576a29a885a5bba
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnumclient-ut-coverage

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-11 16:48:50.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/services/trunk/rpc/test_server.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/services/trunk/rpc/__init__.py', 'neutron/services/trunk/rules.py', 'neutron/services/trunk/rpc/server.py', 'neutron/services/trunk/constants.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Set device_owner for trunk subports"

This is not required by business logic as pointed out in the commit
message, and can lead to race problems. For instance, if a user wants to
set a different device_owner for the subport and triggers an update_port
call to do that right after calling trunk_add_subport, sometimes
(actually most of the time) the follow up update port call may happen
before the internal update_port call made by trunk_add_subport.
Consequently, the device_owner may end up with the wrong value, in this
case the hardcoded trunk:subport.

This reverts commit 72bc7551e8af05ebf9bdab560eeced41823d9502.

Change-Id: I5a66f7956dfb2fbc6e6a184540ef320307c24dd8
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Set device_owner for trunk subports"

This is not required by business logic as pointed out in the commit
message, and can lead to race problems. For instance, if a user wants to
set a different device_owner for the subport and triggers an update_port
call to do that right after calling trunk_add_subport, sometimes
(actually most of the time) the follow up update port call may happen
before the internal update_port call made by trunk_add_subport.
Consequently, the device_owner may end up with the wrong value, in this
case the hardcoded trunk:subport.

This reverts commit 72bc7551e8af05ebf9bdab560eeced41823d9502.

Change-Id: I5a66f7956dfb2fbc6e6a184540ef320307c24dd8

commit_message:
Enable NOVA_USE_SERVICE_TOKEN in nova-next job for Pike

We want to start testing a feature added to nova which
sends a service user token along with the regular user
token to other services like cinder and neutron during
long-running operations. This relies on a change in
devstack and we only run it on branches after stable/ocata.

Change-Id: Iee859b3a09066dcbc60583210b4107b787f0d79a
Depends-On: I2d7348c4a72af96c0ed2ef6c0ab75d16e9aec8fc

commit_message:
Fix novncproxy for python3

The getheader() function isn't available in python3 [1]. Instead one can
simply use get() similar to what is done in the websockify module that
this code is using.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue4773

Change-Id: I349742d80e0abeb7866eeeb647ce18948eff81f8
Partial-Bug: 1663593

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6635, 'name': 'John Davidge', 'email': 'john.davidge@rackspace.com', 'username': 'john-davidge'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20330, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V Networking CI', 'email': 'microsoft_neutron_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'microsoft_neutron_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-18 18:30:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/ipam_pluggable_backend.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ipam_pluggable_backend.py'], 'message': "Fix IPv6 PD with pluggable IPAM

A PD-sepcific check that was present in the non-pluggable IPAM
backend was missing from the pluggable version, causing router
interfaces to be created with a '::1' IP (equal to the gateway on
PD subnets). The resulting command:

ip netns exec <router_namespace> ip -6 addr add ::1/64

would then fail. This patch restores the check to ensure that
'::1' is not used for router interface ports, and introduces a
test to protect against future regressions.

Conflicts:
	neutron/db/ipam_pluggable_backend.py
	neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ipam_pluggable_backend.py

Change-Id: I6a2e7cd60dd42d92b900a57bd8f3ffbc5909908e
Closes-Bug: 1631693
(cherry picked from commit 14ffea4444985eb041181d1bdef9af53ccb4d9f9)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix IPv6 PD with pluggable IPAM

A PD-sepcific check that was present in the non-pluggable IPAM
backend was missing from the pluggable version, causing router
interfaces to be created with a '::1' IP (equal to the gateway on
PD subnets). The resulting command:

ip netns exec <router_namespace> ip -6 addr add ::1/64

would then fail. This patch restores the check to ensure that
'::1' is not used for router interface ports, and introduces a
test to protect against future regressions.

Conflicts:
	neutron/db/ipam_pluggable_backend.py
	neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ipam_pluggable_backend.py

Change-Id: I6a2e7cd60dd42d92b900a57bd8f3ffbc5909908e
Closes-Bug: 1631693
(cherry picked from commit 14ffea4444985eb041181d1bdef9af53ccb4d9f9)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-14 12:24:33.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/vmware/test_vmware_vmdk.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/vmdk.py'], 'message': "VMware: Delete temporary snapshot after clone

VMDK driver creates the new volume as a linked clone of the
source volume if vmware:clone_type is set to 'linked' in the
volume type extra-spec. To create a linked clone, we should
create a temporary snapshot and then create the clone off the
snapshot point. After the clone, we can delete the temporary
snapshot, which we are not doing currently. Fixing it by
deleting the temporary snapshot in the finally block.

Closes-bug: #1664547
Change-Id: I3e198941f1e62af55133de2b3e2c46e898bcc2ed
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: Delete temporary snapshot after clone

VMDK driver creates the new volume as a linked clone of the
source volume if vmware:clone_type is set to 'linked' in the
volume type extra-spec. To create a linked clone, we should
create a temporary snapshot and then create the clone off the
snapshot point. After the clone, we can delete the temporary
snapshot, which we are not doing currently. Fixing it by
deleting the temporary snapshot in the finally block.

Closes-bug: #1664547
Change-Id: I3e198941f1e62af55133de2b3e2c46e898bcc2ed

subject: Adds http proxy support for registering RHEL overcloud nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-11-16 16:50:13.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/pre_deploy/rhel-registration/environment-rhel-registration.yaml', 'extraconfig/pre_deploy/rhel-registration/scripts/rhel-registration', 'extraconfig/pre_deploy/rhel-registration/rhel-registration.yaml'], 'message': 'Adds http proxy support for registering RHEL overcloud nodes

It is quite common in large entreprises that direct HTTP/HTTPS to the outside
world is denied from nodes/systems but reaching out through a proxy is allowed.

This change adds support for an HTTP proxy when RHEL overcloud nodes reach
out to either the RHSM portal or to a satellite server. This allows the
overcloud nodes to download updates even in locked-down environments.

The following variables are settable through templates:
  rhel_reg_http_proxy_host:
  rhel_reg_http_proxy_port:
  rhel_reg_http_proxy_username:
  rhel_reg_http_proxy_password:

Note the following restrictions:
  - If setting rhel_reg_http_proxy_host,
    then rhel_reg_http_proxy_port cannot be empty.
  - If setting rhel_reg_http_proxy_port,
    then rhel_reg_http_proxy_host cannot be empty.
  - If setting rhel_reg_http_proxy_username,
    then rhel_reg_http_proxy_password cannot be empty.
  - If setting rhel_reg_http_proxy_password,
    then rhel_reg_http_proxy_username cannot be empty.
  - If setting either rhel_reg_http_proxy_username or
    rhel_reg_http_proxy_password, then rhel_reg_http_proxy_host
    AND rhel_reg_http_proxy_port cannot be empty

Change-Id: I6181d910a60e6ccdade82377fb88752e2508a466
Implements: http proxy support for subscription-manager on RHEL hosts.
'}]
commit_message:
Adds http proxy support for registering RHEL overcloud nodes

It is quite common in large entreprises that direct HTTP/HTTPS to the outside
world is denied from nodes/systems but reaching out through a proxy is allowed.

This change adds support for an HTTP proxy when RHEL overcloud nodes reach
out to either the RHSM portal or to a satellite server. This allows the
overcloud nodes to download updates even in locked-down environments.

The following variables are settable through templates:
  rhel_reg_http_proxy_host:
  rhel_reg_http_proxy_port:
  rhel_reg_http_proxy_username:
  rhel_reg_http_proxy_password:

Note the following restrictions:
  - If setting rhel_reg_http_proxy_host,
    then rhel_reg_http_proxy_port cannot be empty.
  - If setting rhel_reg_http_proxy_port,
    then rhel_reg_http_proxy_host cannot be empty.
  - If setting rhel_reg_http_proxy_username,
    then rhel_reg_http_proxy_password cannot be empty.
  - If setting rhel_reg_http_proxy_password,
    then rhel_reg_http_proxy_username cannot be empty.
  - If setting either rhel_reg_http_proxy_username or
    rhel_reg_http_proxy_password, then rhel_reg_http_proxy_host
    AND rhel_reg_http_proxy_port cannot be empty

Change-Id: I6181d910a60e6ccdade82377fb88752e2508a466
Implements: http proxy support for subscription-manager on RHEL hosts.

commit_message:
Tunneling application

The tunneling application takes care of tunneling specific
flows.
The tunneling app is improving L2 modularity.
patch include:
*Align classifier and tunneling apps with get_datapath() removal
*Unit test for the tunneling app
*Remove tunneling related funtionality from l2 app
*Fix l2 unit tests to reflect latest modifications
 After removing tunneling flows the old l2 unit tests
 became irrelevant

Partially-implements: blueprint Tunneling-app

Change-Id: I8614b1dfe2ba6fba7f97c25fdb8d228a1c6b21a5

commit_message:
Configure trove_conductor_workers in os_trove

Configure trove_conductor_workers by calculating the default value.
Similar to other services worker threads, the default value for
trove_conductor_workers is half the number of vcpus on the machine.

Also added capping of worker threads for trove.

Change-Id: If853b0e1e45b7137572df8a1123273539343c83e
Closes-Bug: #1664639
(cherry picked from commit fdd59ffe60672e7f4401f2b179d5fb152e0d33a3)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-22 23:26:08.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_common.rb'], 'message': "Remove spurious CIB backup files

There are some situations where we did not clean up CIB backup files
correctly:
1) When a pcs show command was invoked
2) When we hit the maximum number of retries.
3) When the original file and the copy cib file are identical and we
   still called push_config() (very unlikely but we best clean that up)

Let's remove these files in both of these cases.

Closes-Bug: #1667145

Change-Id: I41404d569d81973c4b9531266c7a6c09904d1baf
"}]
commit_message:
Remove spurious CIB backup files

There are some situations where we did not clean up CIB backup files
correctly:
1) When a pcs show command was invoked
2) When we hit the maximum number of retries.
3) When the original file and the copy cib file are identical and we
   still called push_config() (very unlikely but we best clean that up)

Let's remove these files in both of these cases.

Closes-Bug: #1667145

Change-Id: I41404d569d81973c4b9531266c7a6c09904d1baf

subject: Fix scrubber test failing py35 gate.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-17 20:17:40.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/functional/test_scrubber.py'], 'message': 'Fix scrubber test failing py35 gate.

Recently added `test_scrubber_app_queue_errors_not_daemon` test
in glance/tests/functional/test_scrubber.py fails the non-voting
`gate-glance-python35-db-nv` gate job because in python3.5, the
output of subprocess call is a bytes object instead of string.
In preparation for enabling voting on this gate, fixed the failure
by converting the `err` object that is being checked to a string.

Change-Id: If84d572b192758da9dec743678f9f0cb0d563faa
'}]
commit_message:
Fix scrubber test failing py35 gate.

Recently added `test_scrubber_app_queue_errors_not_daemon` test
in glance/tests/functional/test_scrubber.py fails the non-voting
`gate-glance-python35-db-nv` gate job because in python3.5, the
output of subprocess call is a bytes object instead of string.
In preparation for enabling voting on this gate, fixed the failure
by converting the `err` object that is being checked to a string.

Change-Id: If84d572b192758da9dec743678f9f0cb0d563faa

The kwarg really is used - and some virt drivers break without this extra wait.
For example, the XenServer CI became unstable again without this fix

Note that this fix was originally added to ensure stability in this CI
environment (fixing bug 1258635)

This reverts commit 621544cc962b35025d3cbb97e7eb32fa7d9f508a.

Change-Id: I1547bf3ee4bb7a6c1552d0c1fa90280af1a9802c
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Remove wait_for_server from create_image_from_server"

The kwarg really is used - and some virt drivers break without this extra wait.
For example, the XenServer CI became unstable again without this fix

Note that this fix was originally added to ensure stability in this CI
environment (fixing bug 1258635)

This reverts commit 621544cc962b35025d3cbb97e7eb32fa7d9f508a.

Change-Id: I1547bf3ee4bb7a6c1552d0c1fa90280af1a9802c

commit_message:
Add in ironic_service_user_name group_vars/all.yml

The os_nova role is referring to the ironic_service_user_name variable
but it is not defined anywhere.  This patch adds it back into the
default set of variables.

Change-Id: I4b9f49db9b101be84d4792fb2d409c489161c953
Closes-Bug: #1647253

commit_message:
support local.conf instead of localrc

This moves the bulk of devstack-gate to local.conf instead of localrc,
which makes it so that we can do more interesting and complicated
things with the devstack setup.

grenade local.conf support
Depends-On: I9bf5ac24dc87404e054068d7ed643e0bf0fac311

Change-Id: I111a6df3adc07ed426ac714cb9e64667a63e0e5a

subject: Fix add flow twice bug for active port
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-02-22 07:03:52.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/tests/unit/test_df_local_controller.py', 'dragonflow/controller/df_local_controller.py'], 'message': 'Fix add flow twice bug for active port

when df restart, it will add flow twice in current code, this patch fix
the bug by searching corresponding data from db cache instead of from
redis when lport online, and store the active port into cache when no
lport be found first which will wait the lport online later.

Change-Id: I206e13cc36dce8b4be03a45cdd21c7b4d6d4d99f
Closes-bug: #1665868
'}]
commit_message:
Fix add flow twice bug for active port

when df restart, it will add flow twice in current code, this patch fix
the bug by searching corresponding data from db cache instead of from
redis when lport online, and store the active port into cache when no
lport be found first which will wait the lport online later.

Change-Id: I206e13cc36dce8b4be03a45cdd21c7b4d6d4d99f
Closes-bug: #1665868

not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

commit_message:
Cap the number of worker threads

Users can configure the number of worker threads however when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: If0e1f051ecdc0e1cc9713c7300e72e0748e01737
(cherry picked from commit ea00eb26f2078a04f904e2337d16973eaf7a8090)

subject: Split out cinder upgrade into it's own script.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-22 20:34:55.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-cinder-upgrades.sh', 'tests/test-upgrade.yml', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Split out cinder upgrade into it's own script.

This will separate out the runs so that variables and modules are not
re-used across runs - ensuring the latest modules and versions are used,
and ensuring multiple versions of the tests playbook aren't required on
non-upgrade runs.

Change-Id: Ie1885ae20a87f27805d3e0c92adba16510c71b1c
(cherry picked from commit beba04141bdd6ed8ef167a8409c3afb04882a34b)
"}]
commit_message:
Split out cinder upgrade into it's own script.

This will separate out the runs so that variables and modules are not
re-used across runs - ensuring the latest modules and versions are used,
and ensuring multiple versions of the tests playbook aren't required on
non-upgrade runs.

Change-Id: Ie1885ae20a87f27805d3e0c92adba16510c71b1c
(cherry picked from commit beba04141bdd6ed8ef167a8409c3afb04882a34b)

autogenerated for errors and fail if there are any issues

commit_message:
doc: verify all rst files

Make use of doc8 to verify all rst files which are not
autogenerated for errors and fail if there are any issues
found. The doc8 checks are now part of the tox 'docs'
environment and ran automatically. Checks can also be called
direcly via 'tox -e docs'.

commit_message:
Split upgrade testing into it's own shell script

This will separate out the runs so that variables and modules are not
re-used across runs - ensuring the latest modules and versions are used,
and ensuring multiple versions of the tests playbook aren't required on
non-upgrade runs.

Change-Id: Ia79bee91950a841c4ee1fd17fe20d1f7ee994166
(cherry picked from commit 8a29cb390c8ca1efc76396b084f3b6d28c410fae)

commit_message:

commit_message:
Validate -1 as wildcard for the other protocol choice.

As help text indicates, -1 should mean wildcard. However, it
currently is not a valid input. This patch validates -1 as
wildcard for the other protocol choice.

Closes-Bug: #1663168

subject: Add Vary: headers for CORS responses
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14867, 'name': 'Jaivish Kothari(janonymous)', 'email': 'janonymous.codevulture@gmail.com', 'username': 'Janonymous'}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}, {'_account_id': 17106, 'name': 'IanSun', 'email': 'sun.jun@99cloud.net', 'username': 'SunJun'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-19 23:28:24.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': 'Add Vary: headers for CORS responses

From the (non-normative) Implementation Considerations section of
https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/#resource-implementation :

> Resources that wish to enable themselves to be shared with multiple
> Origins but do not respond uniformly with "*" must in practice
> generate the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header dynamically in
> response to every request they wish to allow. As a consequence,
> authors of such resources should send a Vary: Origin HTTP header or
> provide other appropriate control directives to prevent caching of
> such responses, which may be inaccurate if re-used across-origins.

We do the first part (dynamic Access-Control-Allow-Origin: generation
based on the incoming Origin: header), but not the second (send a
Vary: Origin header). Consider this scenario:

 1. Swift user Alice has some static content that should be available
    from some (but not all) other domains. She creates a new container
    with an appropriate X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Allow-Origin
    like "http://foo.example.com http://bar.example.com".

 2. End user Bob pulls up a browser and visits http://foo.example.com,
    which references a cross-origin resource. Seeing this, the browser
    issues a preflight request and gets back a response that includes
    headers like:

        Access-Control-Allow-Origin: http://foo.example.com
        Access-Control-Allow-Methods: HEAD, GET, PUT, POST, COPY,
         OPTIONS, DELETE

    Since the preflight succeeded, the browser follows through on the
    cross-origin request and everything loads properly.

 3. Now Bob visits http://bar.example.com, which references the same
    resource. Ordinarily, the exact same thing would happen, but with
    http://bar.example.com in the headers. However, if the browser
    cached the preflight response (because it didn't want to make two
    requests everytime it needed a resource), it would assume the server
    would only allow resource-sharing with http://foo.example.com and
    not load the resource.

Similar issues arise from the dynamically-generated
Access-Control-Allow-Headers header.

For more information on the Vary: header, see
http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-7.1.4

Change-Id: I9950e593312f654ee596b7f43f7ab9e5b684d8e5
'}]
commit_message:
Add Vary: headers for CORS responses

From the (non-normative) Implementation Considerations section of
https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/#resource-implementation :

> Resources that wish to enable themselves to be shared with multiple
> Origins but do not respond uniformly with "*" must in practice
> generate the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header dynamically in
> response to every request they wish to allow. As a consequence,
> authors of such resources should send a Vary: Origin HTTP header or
> provide other appropriate control directives to prevent caching of
> such responses, which may be inaccurate if re-used across-origins.

We do the first part (dynamic Access-Control-Allow-Origin: generation
based on the incoming Origin: header), but not the second (send a
Vary: Origin header). Consider this scenario:

 1. Swift user Alice has some static content that should be available
    from some (but not all) other domains. She creates a new container
    with an appropriate X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Allow-Origin
    like "http://foo.example.com http://bar.example.com".

 2. End user Bob pulls up a browser and visits http://foo.example.com,
    which references a cross-origin resource. Seeing this, the browser
    issues a preflight request and gets back a response that includes
    headers like:

        Access-Control-Allow-Origin: http://foo.example.com
        Access-Control-Allow-Methods: HEAD, GET, PUT, POST, COPY,
         OPTIONS, DELETE

    Since the preflight succeeded, the browser follows through on the
    cross-origin request and everything loads properly.

 3. Now Bob visits http://bar.example.com, which references the same
    resource. Ordinarily, the exact same thing would happen, but with
    http://bar.example.com in the headers. However, if the browser
    cached the preflight response (because it didn't want to make two
    requests everytime it needed a resource), it would assume the server
    would only allow resource-sharing with http://foo.example.com and
    not load the resource.

Similar issues arise from the dynamically-generated
Access-Control-Allow-Headers header.

For more information on the Vary: header, see
http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-7.1.4

Change-Id: I9950e593312f654ee596b7f43f7ab9e5b684d8e5

subject: XenAPI: Make cirros image file name configurable for XenServer
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6735, 'name': 'Bob Ball', 'email': 'bob.ball@citrix.com', 'username': 'bob-ball'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 17920, 'name': 'Jianghua Wang', 'email': 'jianghua.wang@citrix.com', 'username': 'wjhfresh'}, {'_account_id': 17922, 'name': 'Huan Xie', 'email': 'huan.xie@citrix.com', 'username': 'huan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-17 09:41:42.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest', 'stackrc'], 'message': 'XenAPI: Make cirros image file name configurable for XenServer

In stackrc, currently the cirros image file is hard coded as
cirros-0.3.4-x86_64-disk.vhd.tgz but in lib/tempest it sets
SCENARIO_IMAGE_FILE as
"cirros-${CIRROS_VERSION}-${CIRROS_ARCH}-disk.vhd.tgz".
Once CIRROS_VERSION or CIRROS_ARCH change, it will cause
mismatching. So let's change stackrc to depend on the variables
also. And change lib/tempest to use the variables defined in
stackrc. So we can control the overidable variables to specify
the cirros image version in a consistent way.

Change-Id: I6f48aa58dc5dcf5c18c48418d5ef4b4f2a6496eb
'}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: Make cirros image file name configurable for XenServer

In stackrc, currently the cirros image file is hard coded as
cirros-0.3.4-x86_64-disk.vhd.tgz but in lib/tempest it sets
SCENARIO_IMAGE_FILE as
"cirros-${CIRROS_VERSION}-${CIRROS_ARCH}-disk.vhd.tgz".
Once CIRROS_VERSION or CIRROS_ARCH change, it will cause
mismatching. So let's change stackrc to depend on the variables
also. And change lib/tempest to use the variables defined in
stackrc. So we can control the overidable variables to specify
the cirros image version in a consistent way.

Change-Id: I6f48aa58dc5dcf5c18c48418d5ef4b4f2a6496eb

commit_message:
Use min parameter to restrict live-migration config options

UpgradeImpact: IntOpt type provides min parameter to restrict integer's
minimum value in oslo.config, and will generate description about this
in the format like '# Minimum value: XXX', then we don't need round up
the minimum value quietly in code.

Change-Id: I54592ba4f46c2d6260f1513e5e29dd466c89724d

on an overcloud deployment depending on the services enabled

subject: Only reset current resource's attrs in state_set
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-08 02:10:17.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/stack.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': "Only reset current resource's attrs in state_set

There is no need to reset other resources' attributes in the stack
when a resource calls state_set(), the other resources attributes will
get updated as they are visited. This is not a huge performance gain
since those resources would have been in memory anyway, but let's not
use the big hammer if we don't have to.

Change-Id: Icafd770055a3dc2f1f3262753a8dca045e38972d
"}]
commit_message:
Only reset current resource's attrs in state_set

There is no need to reset other resources' attributes in the stack
when a resource calls state_set(), the other resources attributes will
get updated as they are visited. This is not a huge performance gain
since those resources would have been in memory anyway, but let's not
use the big hammer if we don't have to.

Change-Id: Icafd770055a3dc2f1f3262753a8dca045e38972d

commit_message:
Setup service user configuration in nova.conf

In Nova, service token will be passed along with user token to communicate
with services when dealing with long running tasks like live migration.

This change addresses adding service user configuration for nova in
devstack.

Part of Nova blueprint use-service-tokens

Depends-On: I51eb0a8937fa39a2e5dafb1ad915e7113ea61f72

Co-Authored-By: Sarafraj Singh <sarafraj.singh@intel.com>

Change-Id: I2d7348c4a72af96c0ed2ef6c0ab75d16e9aec8fc

This is a work in progress for automated Calamari deployment

commit_message:
[WIP] Adding in support for automated Calamari Integration

This is a work in progress for automated Calamari deployment
via TripleO. Currently this uses the ctlplane network for
traffic which will need to be changed, and does not support
external Ceph at present - it has to use the local Ceph
environment.

Change-Id: I8bfe51cc326d2e53392adb835ad3368811b6ffb8

commit_message:
Filter empty messages when creating claims in Swift

Messages can be removed while a claim is created, resulting in an empty
body returned from Swift. This ignores those messages.

Change-Id: I7f6500c743449abd4ce7adb6f361d31a6b8439f8

When generating fencing parameters, we now match nodes from the
Ironic/Nova hostmap, by Ironic node name, rather than MAC address, as it
is more robust on nodes with multiple network interfaces.

Change-Id: I22796fcb06e9a75cd2c29263b52a2aaa9fe91bbe

commit_message:
Improve node identification in fencing parameter generation.

When generating fencing parameters, we now match nodes from the
Ironic/Nova hostmap, by Ironic node name, rather than MAC address, as it
is more robust on nodes with multiple network interfaces.

Change-Id: I22796fcb06e9a75cd2c29263b52a2aaa9fe91bbe
Closes-Bug: #1666989
(cherry picked from commit f5965a6993d5797c2b2f714414f9c731ee577d6c)

commit_message:
Rename neutron_dhcp_domain to neutron_dns_domain

The dhcp_domain option has been marked for deprecation since Liberty and
was removed in Ocata [1]. Its replacement, dns_domain, should be used
instead.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/406243/

Change-Id: Ibb7111fe2c177b256dcc6d7474d9ca25a97124bd
Depends-On: Ie46ccba05e02e1ec51dd0d61ab6d9d028b32b400
(cherry picked from commit 259992d707c943576b20d8fa611f6ea2719b352f)

Finally, remove the push_destination attribute to make it default to

Change-Id: Ifc0939d08ac9a9d35745c81a6a5f719ccee02b04

"}]
commit_message:
Use latest containers for master branch

The master branch should use containers tagged with 'latest' instead of
a named openstack version.

Also stop pulling the containers that are not currently being used.
With the new arch that is in the pipes, we use the host's
os-collect-config agent and also use the target containers directly to
generate the configuration files with puppet, making the heat-agents
container useless. The master branch also stopped using the ovs
containers in favor of the host's ovs.

Finally, remove the push_destination attribute to make it default to
the host's control plane IP address on port 8787.

Change-Id: Ifc0939d08ac9a9d35745c81a6a5f719ccee02b04
Depends-On: Ibcff99f03e6751fbf3197adefd5d344178b71fc2

commit_message:
Allow pushing docker images to host's ctl plane IP

This commit allows image uploader config file with missing
'push_destination' attributes. In which case, the host's control plane
(br-ctlplane) IP address with port 8787 is used or localhost if there
is no such interface.

Change-Id: Idfe18f25ddee944ef96ab14f8edeb056656a06bc

subject: docker: expose agent mounts as template param
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-15 22:18:01.000000000', 'files': ['docker/firstboot/install_docker_agents.yaml', 'docker/firstboot/start_docker_agents.sh'], 'message': 'docker: expose agent mounts as template param

This change adds the template parameter DockerAgentMounts to
install_docker_agents.yaml so that the agent volume mounts can be
represented as a YAML list. This is to allow:
- grouping the mounts by purpose and documenting with YAML comments
- allowing operators to specify custom DockerAgentMounts to complement
  other customisations (custom config can perform any action, so
  mounts may need to be changed to make that possible)
- allowing developers to specify custom DockerAgentMounts while making
  other changes before having to modify the defaults in
  install_docker_agents.yaml

The service heat-docker-agents has been renamed to heat-agents, so it
has the same name as the docker container which it runs.

This change also writes AGENT_IMAGE and AGENT_COMMAND_MOUNTS to
environment files in /etc/sysconfig/ to allow another non-boottime
mechanism to upgrade the heat-agents service.

Change-Id: I14d88296a9038ad4a1589cf6c95bba0f5d19a17f
'}]
commit_message:
docker: expose agent mounts as template param

This change adds the template parameter DockerAgentMounts to
install_docker_agents.yaml so that the agent volume mounts can be
represented as a YAML list. This is to allow:
- grouping the mounts by purpose and documenting with YAML comments
- allowing operators to specify custom DockerAgentMounts to complement
  other customisations (custom config can perform any action, so
  mounts may need to be changed to make that possible)
- allowing developers to specify custom DockerAgentMounts while making
  other changes before having to modify the defaults in
  install_docker_agents.yaml

The service heat-docker-agents has been renamed to heat-agents, so it
has the same name as the docker container which it runs.

This change also writes AGENT_IMAGE and AGENT_COMMAND_MOUNTS to
environment files in /etc/sysconfig/ to allow another non-boottime
mechanism to upgrade the heat-agents service.

Change-Id: I14d88296a9038ad4a1589cf6c95bba0f5d19a17f

subject: Serialize Keystone and manage haproxy endpoints
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-21 19:23:14.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/os-keystone-install.yml', 'playbooks/common-tasks/haproxy-endpoint-manage.yml'], 'message': 'Serialize Keystone and manage haproxy endpoints

Serialize keystone to run the playbook on 1 container first, then
run on the remainder of the containers in the environment.

This also adds a common-task include to disable the haproxy endpoints
for the containers where the role is running, then re-enable them
in the post tasks.

The haproxy endpoint management task will wait for up to 2 minutes
by default for the endpoint to report a healthy/UP or drained/MAINT
state.

Change-Id: I0df71255154cfb28b62bb14736ba0c8fc1f6ae66
'}]
commit_message:
Serialize Keystone and manage haproxy endpoints

Serialize keystone to run the playbook on 1 container first, then
run on the remainder of the containers in the environment.

This also adds a common-task include to disable the haproxy endpoints
for the containers where the role is running, then re-enable them
in the post tasks.

The haproxy endpoint management task will wait for up to 2 minutes
by default for the endpoint to report a healthy/UP or drained/MAINT
state.

Change-Id: I0df71255154cfb28b62bb14736ba0c8fc1f6ae66

commit_message:
Add in ironic_service_user_name group_vars/all.yml

The os_nova role is referring to the ironic_service_user_name variable
but it is not defined anywhere.  This patch adds it back into the
default set of variables.

Change-Id: I4b9f49db9b101be84d4792fb2d409c489161c953
Closes-Bug: #1647253

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-22 19:31:59.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/neutron_init_systemd.yml', 'tasks/neutron_init_common.yml'], 'message': "Add program name to neutron init tasks

This patch adds the program name to the neutron init tasks so that
it's easier to review the logs and determine which services are
being changed. It also brings the systemd tasks into the common tasks
file since all supported distributions have systemd available.

Change-Id: Ic0dbab2a5fefe411331867639e236a82a0b32985
(cherry picked from commit f281a4844da3defe10d7873cb60461a48b3ba7e2)
"}]
commit_message:
Add program name to neutron init tasks

This patch adds the program name to the neutron init tasks so that
it's easier to review the logs and determine which services are
being changed. It also brings the systemd tasks into the common tasks
file since all supported distributions have systemd available.

Change-Id: Ic0dbab2a5fefe411331867639e236a82a0b32985
(cherry picked from commit f281a4844da3defe10d7873cb60461a48b3ba7e2)

commit_message:
Fix CVE-2016-7404

This commit addresses multiple potential vulnerabilities in
Magnum. It makes the following changes:

* Permissions for /etc/sysconfig/heat-params inside Magnum
  created instances are tightened to 0600 (used to be 0755).
* Certificate retrieval is modified to work without the need
  for a Keystone trust.
* The cluster's Keystone trust id is only passed into
  instances for clusters where that is actually needed. This
  prevents the trustee user from consuming the trust in cases
  where it is not needed.
* The configuration setting trust/cluster_user_trust (False by
  default) is introduced. It needs to be explicitely enabled
  by the cloud operator to allow clusters that need the
  trust_id to be passed into instances to work. Without this
  setting, attempts to create such clusters will fail.

Please note, that none of these changes apply to existing
clusters. They will have to be deleted and rebuilt to benefit
from these changes.

Change-Id: I643d408cde0d6e30812cf6429fb7118184793400

commit_message:
Fix CVE-2016-7404

This commit addresses multiple potential vulnerabilities in
Magnum. It makes the following changes:

* Permissions for /etc/sysconfig/heat-params inside Magnum
  created instances are tightened to 0600 (used to be 0755).
* Certificate retrieval is modified to work without the need
  for a Keystone trust.
* The cluster's Keystone trust id is only passed into
  instances for clusters where that is actually needed. This
  prevents the trustee user from consuming the trust in cases
  where it is not needed.
* The configuration setting trust/cluster_user_trust (False by
  default) is introduced. It needs to be explicitely enabled
  by the cloud operator to allow clusters that need the
  trust_id to be passed into instances to work. Without this
  setting, attempts to create such clusters will fail.

Please note, that none of these changes apply to existing
clusters. They will have to be deleted and rebuilt to benefit
from these changes.

(cherry picked from commit e93d82e8b3bc19211efd54edc17aebdca50670c1)

Change-Id: I643d408cde0d6e30812cf6429fb7118184793400

'ironic/tests/unit/api/v1/test_notification_utils.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_iscsi_deploy.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_agent_base_vendor.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/ilo/test_management.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/ilo/test_boot.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/api/base.py'], 'message': 'Use unittest.mock on Python 3

The mock module has been added to Python 3.3 as unittest.mock.

The third party mock module just a backport for python 2.7 of
unittest.mock which is available starting from python 3.3.

oslotest prepares mock for six in oslotest/__init__.py as follow:
six.add_move(six.MovedModule('mock', 'mock', 'unittest.mock')) and
ironic/tests/__init__.py imports oslotest before importing test
submodules to setup six.moves for mock, then "from six.moves import
mock" works well.

Note: unittest.mock also detects wrong usage of method
assert_called_once_with.

Change-Id: Ib345b067d6d5dbd38fcf7f2707356d0437b5c757
'}]
commit_message:
Use unittest.mock on Python 3

The mock module has been added to Python 3.3 as unittest.mock.

The third party mock module just a backport for python 2.7 of
unittest.mock which is available starting from python 3.3.

oslotest prepares mock for six in oslotest/__init__.py as follow:
six.add_move(six.MovedModule('mock', 'mock', 'unittest.mock')) and
ironic/tests/__init__.py imports oslotest before importing test
submodules to setup six.moves for mock, then "from six.moves import
mock" works well.

Note: unittest.mock also detects wrong usage of method
assert_called_once_with.

Change-Id: Ib345b067d6d5dbd38fcf7f2707356d0437b5c757

subject: Add a new strategy filtering tasks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-22 20:15:41.000000000', 'files': ['strategy/artifacting.py'], 'message': 'Add a new strategy filtering tasks

Ideally Ansible should allow (from a playbook) to run only part
of a role thanks to its tags (like the --skip-tags or --tags from
the cli). But it's not possible now.

This code is a PoC code for introducing a kind of filtering,
which basically skips tasks containing the word "config".

If you are building lxc images ("artifacts") of a role, you
probably don't want to run all the tasks in the role, and don't
want to run the handler tasks (because they start software for
example). This also addresses it.

To use this work, just include strategy: artifacting in your
play.

Change-Id: I006bc640c6563c959ceb835ddf5bef8d25dd7517
(cherry picked from commit 655d7777342b8446d94d0f81dda293740c574d3d)
'}]
commit_message:
Add a new strategy filtering tasks

Ideally Ansible should allow (from a playbook) to run only part
of a role thanks to its tags (like the --skip-tags or --tags from
the cli). But it's not possible now.

This code is a PoC code for introducing a kind of filtering,
which basically skips tasks containing the word "config".

If you are building lxc images ("artifacts") of a role, you
probably don't want to run all the tasks in the role, and don't
want to run the handler tasks (because they start software for
example). This also addresses it.

To use this work, just include strategy: artifacting in your
play.

Change-Id: I006bc640c6563c959ceb835ddf5bef8d25dd7517
(cherry picked from commit 655d7777342b8446d94d0f81dda293740c574d3d)
